Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: అழுக்காற்றின் అల్లவை செய்யார் இழுக்காற்றின்ஏதம் படுபாக்கு அறிந்து.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: (The wise) knowing the misery that comes from transgression will not through envy commit unrighteous deeds.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wise person is tempted by a shadowy figure of Envy to commit an unrighteous act ('అల్లவை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The wise person's foresight allows them to see the inevitable consequence of such an act. A clear vision appears before them, showing the terrible disgrace and misery ('ஏதம் படுபாக்கு') that results from such a transgression ('ఇழுக்காற்றின்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Because they have this knowledge ('అறிந்து'), they resolutely turn their back on the temptation of envy and refuse to commit the unrighteous deed ('செய்யார்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The wise do not commit evil deeds out of envy because they have the wisdom to foresee the inevitable misery and disgrace that will follow.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The prophetic vision of future misery is the key element that motivates the wise person's refusal. Envy is a tempting but ultimately powerless force against true wisdom and foresight.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The wise person stands in a clear, bright light of wisdom. The figure of Envy is a dark shadow. The vision of future misery is filled with a dark, painful, and shameful light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot focusing on the wise person's face as they look at the vision of consequence and make their determined refusal.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a strong focus on the expression of wise resolve.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The clear light of wisdom allows the person to see the dark future of the evil path, and thus avoid it.

Cultural_Anchors: They will not do evil out of envy (అழுக்காற்றின் అల్లவை செய்யார்)
